text: In Greek mythology, Orneus (; Ancient Greek: Ὀρνεύς) was the son of King Erechtheus and Praxithea and the father of Peteus. Through Peteus, Orneus is the grandfather of Menestheus.Plutarch, Theseus, 32. 1 The town of Orneae is believed to be named after him.Pausanias, Description of Greece, 2. 25. 6; 10. 35. 8 == References == Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Orneus
